Samanway

Part I: Physics, Chemistry and Biology

12 April 2014

About Samanway

The Students’ Council, Indian Institute of Science is organizing Samanway – an Industry-Academia interaction event. The event will host talks by eminent people in the industry and will be one of the first initiatives to provide a platform for students to interact with industry experts about research opportunities in niche sectors of science. The companies that conduct research in science generally face a dearth of skilled candidates from India with scientific temper. The event seeks to address this by opening up avenues for future employee-employer relations.

To cover different areas of scientific research effectively, Samanway will be organized in three parts:



Part I: Pure Sciences This event will be focused on industrial research in pure sciences (Biology, Physics, Chemistry). This event will be conducted on 12 April, 2014, at auditorium of the new Biological Sciences building, Indian Institute of Science. The event would host panel discussion, presentations by companies and student interactions at stalls.

Part II: Computational Engineering This part will focus on applied mathematics research including but not limited to computer science, simulations, modeling, communication and information technology, design and imaging.



Part III: Production and Manufacturing This part will focus on science and engineering disciplines including but not limited to production technology, manufacturing, robotics, and AI.



Each part is designed to attract students from all branches of scientific research. IISc is home to students enrolled in Master's degree programs in Engineering, an integrated Ph.D. (post-B.Sc.) program in Sciences and Ph.D. programs in a wide spectrum of disciplines. The first batch of students from the 4-year B. S. program is graduating this year with a fundamental training in science and exposure to research. Samanway 2014 would provide the companies an opportunity to reach out to a multifarious talent pool.

We offer the following sponsorship options to companies



Alpha Sponsor

25000
  • A slot for presentation/talk on the podium
  • Stalls to showcase research, interact with students and exchange contacts
  • Company logo on all event banners
  • A column in the event newsletter

Beta Sponsor

10000
  • Stalls to showcase research, interact with students and exchange contacts
  • A column in the event newsletter

Gamma Sponsor

Negotiable
  • A column in the newsletter and other communications including event banner
